page.title: 18Tourism 4
page.content: Kunick Holdings'{Water Theme Park}in the Council's{North Bay open-air pool} was{Scarborough's}newest tourist attraction in 1984. Two waterslides descend snakily from the hillside 65 feet above the pool. {"Waterscene"} also includes a jacuzzi, water-cannon and diving boards into a bubble-pool. Daytime admission is 3 pounds for adults and 2 pounds for children, evenings one pound. The unanimous verdict of visitors from Scotland and the north was excellent value for money, but there ought also to be a restaurant on the site.
